Description: “Making biryani from scratch can take time and effort however with National’s famous Sindhi biryani mix, we guarantee you will be indulging in Daigi style traditional biryani without the extra hassle. This recipe mix will ensure your chicken/meat and potatoes are cooked in our perfect blend of spices and herbs that give maximum flavour and heat with each grain of rice infused in fragrant aroma that you just can’t resist!
Recipe:
Here's a simple Sindhi Biryani recipe using the Sindhi Biryani Mix from National Foods:

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Sindhi Biryani Mix (1 packet)
2. 2 cups of basmati rice (washed and soaked for 30 minutes)
3. 1.5 liters of water
4. 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
5. 1 large onion, finely chopped
6. 2 medium-sized tomatoes, finely chopped
7. 2 green chilies, slit
8. 1 inch piece of cinnamon
9. 2 cloves
10. 2 cardamoms
11. 2 bay leaves
12. 1 cup of yogurt (whisked until smooth)
13. 1 cup of boiled and peeled potatoes
14. 1 cup of boiled and peeled peas
15. Salt to taste
16. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a deep pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
2. Add the finely chopped tomatoes, green chilies, cinnamon, cloves, cardamoms, and bay leaves. Sauté until the tomatoes are soft.
3. Add the Sindhi Biryani Mix to the pot and stir well to combine with the onions and tomatoes.
4. Add the soaked rice to the pot, followed by 1.5 liters of water. Stir well to ensure that there are no lumps.
5. Season with salt and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes or until the rice is cooked and the water has been absorbed.
6. Stir in the whisked yogurt, boiled potatoes, and peas. Mix well and let the biryani cook for an additional 5 minutes.
7. Turn off the heat, garnish with fresh coriander leaves, and serve hot with raita and papad.

Enjoy your Sindhi Biryani!
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Sindhi Biryani Mix (1 packet)
2. 2 cups of basmati rice (washed and soaked for 30 minutes)
13. 1 cup of boiled and peeled potatoes
14. 1 cup of boiled and peeled peas

Description: Prepare delicious Pulao in no time with the help of National Pulao Mix. Mixed with varieties of herbs and spices, this mix adds a fragrant aroma and wholesome flavour to every grain of rice and meat. Create your own variation of Pulao with our mix as this can be added to chicken, meat, chickpeas and/or vegetables. Best served with Raita.
Recipe:
Here's a simple and delicious recipe for Vegetable Pulao:

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Pulao Recipe Mix (1 packet)
2. Vegetable Oil (2 tablespoons)
3. Onion (1 large, finely chopped)
4. Garlic (2 cloves, minced)
5. Green Chili (1-2, finely chopped) (Optional, for spice)
6. Carrots (1 medium, sliced)
7. Peas (1 cup, frozen)
8. Cauliflower (1 cup, chopped)
9. Green Bell Pepper (1 medium, chopped)
10. Salt to taste
11. Water (2 cups)
12. Fresh Coriander Leaves (for garnish)

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, and green chili (if using). Sauté until the onions turn translucent.
2. Add the sliced carrots and stir-fry for a couple of minutes.
3. Add the chopped cauliflower, peas, and green bell pepper. Stir-fry until the vegetables are slightly tender.
4. Add the contents of the Pulao Recipe Mix packet and mix well.
5. Add salt to taste.
6. Pour in 2 cups of water and stir well. Bring the mixture to a boil.
7. Reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 10-12 minutes, or until the water is fully absorbed and the rice is cooked.
8. Turn off the heat and let it rest for a few minutes before fluffing with a fork.
9. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Vegetable Pulao!
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Pulao Recipe Mix (1 packet)

Description: Making biryani from scratch can take time and effort however with National\’s famous Biryani mix, we guarantee you will be indulging in Daigi style traditional biryani without the extra hassle. This recipe mix will ensure your chicken/meat and potatoes are cooked in our perfect blend of spices and herbs that give maximum flavour and heat with each grain of rice infused in fragrant aroma that you just can\’t resist
Recipe:
Here's a simple and delicious Biryani recipe using National Foods Biryani Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Biryani Recipe Mix (1 packet)
2. 2 cups of basmati rice (washed and soaked for 30 minutes)
3. 1.5 liters of water
4. 4 tablespoons of vegetable oil
5. 1 large onion (finely chopped)
6. 2 cloves of garlic (minced)
7. 1 inch piece of ginger (grated)
8. 2 green chilies (slit)
9. 1 cup of mixed vegetables (like peas, carrots, and corn)
10. 1 cup of chopped tomatoes
11. 1 cup of yogurt
12. 1-2 cups of water (for the yogurt)
13. 1 tablespoon of lemon juice
14. Salt to taste
15. 2 boiled potatoes, sliced (optional)
16. 2 hard-boiled eggs, sliced (optional)
17. 2 tablespoons of garam masala
18. 2 tablespoons of chopped coriander leaves for garnish
19. 2-3 green chilies, slit (for garnish)
20. 2 limes, cut into wedges (for serving)

Instructions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, garlic, and ginger, and sauté until golden brown.
2. Add the green chilies and mixed vegetables, and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
3. Add the chopped tomatoes and salt, and cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.
4. In a separate bowl, mix the Biryani Recipe Mix powder with yogurt and water (as per the package instructions). Add lemon juice.
5. Add this yogurt mixture to the pot and stir well.
6. Drain the soaked rice and add it to the pot. Stir well to ensure the rice is well coated with the mixture.
7. Add 1.5 liters of water, and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 15-20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the water has been absorbed.
8. After the rice is cooked, fluff it with a fork and mix in the boiled potatoes and eggs (if using).
9. Sprinkle garam masala and mix well.
10. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves, slit green chilies, and lime wedges before serving.

Enjoy your delicious Biryani!
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Biryani Recipe Mix (1 packet)
2. 2 cups of basmati rice (washed and soaked for 30 minutes)
9. 1 cup of mixed vegetables (like peas, carrots, and corn)
18. 2 tablespoons of chopped coriander leaves for garnish

Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for Chicken Biryani using the Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix from National Foods:

Ingredients:
1. 500g (1.1 lbs) Boneless Chicken Breasts, cut into cubes
2. 2 tablespoons Oil
3. 1 packet Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix from National Foods
4. 2 cups Basmati Rice, rinsed and drained
5. 4 cups Water
6. 1 large Onion, finely chopped
7. 2 medium Tomatoes, finely chopped
8. 2 Green Chillies, slit
9. 2 cloves Garlic, minced
10. 1 inch Ginger, grated
11. 1/2 cup Coriander Leaves, chopped
12. 1 cup Yogurt (optional, for a creamier texture)
13. Salt to taste
14. 2 Boiled Eggs (optional)
15. Sliced Almonds, dried fruits, and fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
2. Add garlic, ginger, and green chillies to the pot and sauté for a minute.
3. Add the finely chopped tomatoes and stir until they soften.
4. Add the Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix and stir well to combine with the onions, tomatoes, and spices.
5. Add the chicken cubes to the pot and stir well to coat them in the spice mixture. Cook for about 5 minutes, until the chicken is lightly browned.
6. If using, add the yogurt and stir well to combine with the chicken and spices. Cook for another 2 minutes.
7. Add the rinsed Basmati rice to the pot and stir well to ensure each grain is coated with the spice mixture.
8. Add 4 cups of water to the pot and stir well. Season with salt.
9. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the rice is cooked and the water has been absorbed.
10. Turn off the heat and let the biryani rest for 10 minutes, covered.
11. Fluff the rice with a fork and mix in the chopped coriander leaves.
12. Garnish with sliced almonds, dried fruits, and fresh coriander leaves. If desired, you can also add boiled eggs to the biryani.
13. Serve hot with raita or your choice of side dish.

Enjoy your Chicken Biryani!
Ingredients: 1. 500g Boneless Chicken Breasts, cut into cubes
3. 1 packet Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix from National Foods
4. 2 cups Basmati Rice, rinsed and drained

Description: Add excitement to the dining table by serving delicious authentic Karahi Gosht with the help of National karahi gosht Recipe Mix. A flavorful blend of spices and herbs that delivers aroma and flavorsome taste. Now serve restaurant quality food from the comfort of your home.
Recipe:
Karahi Gosht Recipe Mix is a convenient preparation for making Pakistani-style mutton curry. Here's a simple recipe using this mix:

**Karahi Gosht Recipe using National Foods Karahi Gosht Mix**

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Karahi Gosht Mix (1 packet)
2. 500g Mutton, cut into cubes
3. 2 medium-sized onions, finely chopped
4. 2 tomatoes, finely chopped
5. 2 cloves garlic, minced
6. 1 inch ginger, minced
7. 2 green chilies, slit
8. 2 tablespoons oil
9. 1 cup water
10. Salt to taste
11. 2 tablespoons coriander leaves, chopped (for garnish)

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a karahi (wok) over medium heat.
2. Add the chopped onions and fry until they turn golden brown.
3. Add the minced garlic and ginger, and sauté for a minute.
4. Add the green chilies and fry for another minute.
5. Add the chopped tomatoes and cook until they become soft and mushy.
6. Add the contents of the Karahi Gosht Mix packet. Stir well to mix it with the onion-tomato mixture.
7. Add mutton cubes, salt, and water. Stir well to ensure that the mutton is well coated with the spice mix.
8. Cover the karahi and let it simmer on medium-low heat for about 30 minutes or until the mutton is tender. Stir occasionally.
9. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Karahi Gosht! Remember, you can adjust the spiciness according to your taste by adding more or fewer green chilies.
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Karahi Gosht Mix (1 packet)

Description: Prepare traditional chatkharidar Achar Gosht in no time with the help of National Achar Gosht Masala Mix. Mixed with varieties of herbs and spices, this mix adds a fragrant aroma and a spicy tangy flavour of pickles to your meat.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for Achar Gosht using the mix:

Ingredients:
1. 500g (1.1 lbs) boneless mutton or beef, cut into cubes
2. 3 tablespoons Achar Gosht Recipe Mix
3. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
4. 1 large onion, finely chopped
5. 2-3 cloves garlic, minced
6. 1 inch piece of ginger, grated
7. 2 green chilies, slit
8. 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
9. 1 cup (250 ml) water
10. Salt to taste
11. 2 tablespoons lemon juice
12. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Wash the mutton or beef cubes and pat dry with a clean kitchen towel. Set aside.
2. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add the chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and slit green chilies to the pot. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.
4. Add the Achar Gosht Recipe Mix to the pot and stir well, making sure the spices are well-coated with the oil. Cook for a minute or two, until the aroma of the spices is released.
5. Add the mutton or beef cubes to the pot and stir well to ensure they are evenly coated with the spice mixture. Cook for a few minutes until the meat starts to change color.
6. Add water to the pot and stir well. Season with salt. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 45 minutes to an hour, or until the meat is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent the meat from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
7. Check the seasoning and add more salt if needed. Stir in the lemon juice.
8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Achar Gosht with rice or roti!
Ingredients: 1. 500g boneless mutton or beef, cut into cubes

Description: Prepare traditional Daigi style Quorma with National Quorma Recipe Mix. A combination of rich and fragrant spices and herbs that helps you prepare a delicious quorma in no time! Includes a Free ” National Bombay Biryani Recipe Mix” Sachet in the box, to add more to your dinner table.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe using Quorma Recipe Mix:

Quorma with Quorma Recipe Mix

Ingredients:
1. Quorma Recipe Mix - 1 pack (usually around 450 grams)
2. Vegetable Oil - 3 tablespoons
3. Onions, finely chopped - 2 large
4. Garlic, minced - 2 cloves
5. Ginger, grated - 1 inch piece
6. Tomatoes, finely chopped - 2 medium
7. Green Chilies, finely chopped - 2 (adjust to taste)
8. Water - 4 cups
9. Salt to taste
10. Coriander Leaves, finely chopped - 1 bunch
11. Garam Masala - 1 teaspoon
12. Red Chili Powder - 1 teaspoon
13. Turmeric Powder - 1/2 teaspoon
14. Yogurt, whisked - 1/2 cup (optional)

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions, garlic, and ginger, and sauté until they turn golden brown.
2. Add tomatoes and green chilies, and cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.
3. Add the Quorma Recipe Mix to the pot, stirring continuously to prevent burning.
4. Pour in water, salt, garam masala, red chili powder, and turmeric. Stir well.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the Quorma mix has thickened.
6. If you prefer a creamier Quorma, stir in the whisked yogurt at this point.
7. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
8. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Quorma with rice or naan bread!

Description: Prepare delicious Paya salan with the help of National Paya Recipe Mix. A perfect blend of aromatic and rich herbs and spices creating a flavorsome traditional meal. An ideal dish to serve in dawat and events in the winter season.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for Paya, using Paya Recipe Mix:

**Paya (Tripe Stew) Recipe using National Foods Paya Recipe Mix**

Ingredients:
1. 1 pack of National Foods Paya Recipe Mix
2. 1 kg of tripe (honeycomb tripe is the best for this recipe)
3. 1 large onion, sliced
4. 2-3 tomatoes, chopped
5. 2-3 cloves of garlic, minced
6. 1 thumb-sized piece of ginger, grated
7. 4-5 cups of water
8. Salt to taste
9. Optional: 1-2 green chilies for spice
10. 1 tablespoon of oil

Instructions:
1. Rinse the tripe thoroughly under cold running water. Soak it in salted water for at least 30 minutes to an hour to remove any impurities. Drain and rinse again.
2. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the sliced onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
3. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot. Stir well to mix with the onions.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes to the pot and cook until they soften.
5. Add the drained tripe to the pot and stir well to coat it with the tomato mixture.
6. Dissolve the Paya Recipe Mix in 4 cups of water. Pour this mixture over the tripe.
7. Add the remaining water (up to 5 cups) to the pot. If you prefer a thicker stew, you can add less water.
8. Season with salt. If you like spicy food, add the green chilies at this stage.
9. Stir well, ensure the Paya Mix is well distributed.
10. Cover the pot and let it simmer on low heat for about 1.5 hours or until the tripe is tender. Stir occasionally to prevent the stew from sticking to the bottom of the pot.
11. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary.
12. Serve hot with rice or bread.

Enjoy your Paya stew! Remember, you can always adjust the ingredients and spices to fit your personal taste preferences.

Description: Traditional mix of cumin, turmeric, ginger spices and dry herbs, blended to form the perfect home-made style curry mix. A delicious flavorsome desi taste and a fragrant aroma to make your meal burst with flavour. A perfect option for easy cooking & instant serving for any event.
Recipe:
A simple recipe for Chicken Curry using National Foods Curry Powder Recipe Mix. Here it is:

Ingredients:
1. 500g boneless and skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
2. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 tablespoon grated ginger
6. 2 green chilies, finely chopped (optional, for spiciness)
7. 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
8. 1 can (400g) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
9. 1 cup coconut milk
10. 1 packet National Foods Curry Powder Recipe Mix
11. Salt to taste
12. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
13. 2 cups of cooked basmati rice to serve

Instructions:
1. Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are browned and cooked through. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
2. In the same pan, add the onion, garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Cook until the onion is translucent.
3. Stir in the Curry Powder Recipe Mix and cook for about a minute, until the spices are fragrant.
4. Add the diced tomatoes, chickpeas, and coconut milk to the pan. Stir well to combine.
5. Return the cooked chicken to the pan and season with salt to taste.
6. Simmer the curry for about 10-15 minutes, until the flavors have melded together.
7. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving with cooked basmati rice.

Enjoy your Chicken Curry! Remember, you can adjust the ingredients to your liking. If you like it spicier, you can add more green chilies, or if you prefer a creamier curry, you can add more coconut milk.
Ingredients: 10. 1 packet National Foods Curry Powder Recipe Mix

Description: National Murghi Masala provides the ultimate blend of spices and herbs to give your Chicken Gravy a distinctive flavor and aroma. Conveniently prepare dishes without compromising on taste with help of our recipe mix.
Recipe:
Here's a simple Murghi Tikka recipe using National Foods Murghi Recipe Mix. This recipe serves 4 people.

Ingredients:
1. 500g boneless chicken, cut into cubes
2. 1 packet (250g) of National Foods Murghi Recipe Mix
3. 1 cup yogurt
4. 2 tablespoons oil
5. 2 tablespoons lemon juice
6. 2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves
7. Salt to taste
8. 2 large onions, sliced
9. 2 large green bell peppers, sliced
10. Skewers (if you have them, otherwise you can use a baking tray)

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix the Murghi Recipe Mix with yogurt, oil, lemon juice, salt, and half of the chopped coriander leaves. Add the chicken cubes and mix well to ensure all pieces are well coated. Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes or up to 2 hours in the refrigerator.
2. Preheat your grill or broiler to medium-high heat. If using skewers, thread the marinated chicken pieces onto them. If not, you can place the pieces directly on the grill or in a single layer on a baking sheet.
3. Grill the chicken for about 5-7 minutes on each side, or until the outside is browned and the inside is cooked through.
4. While the chicken is grilling, heat some oil in a pan and sauté the sliced onions and bell peppers until they are softened. Season with salt to taste.
5. Once the chicken is done, serve it with the sautéed onions and bell peppers on top. Garnish with the remaining coriander leaves.

Enjoy your Murghi Tikka!
Ingredients: 2. 1 packet (250g) of National Foods Murghi Recipe Mix
These are the ingredients listed in the Murghi Tikka recipe.

Description: Prepare delicious kofta curry with the help of National Kofta Recipe Mix. A perfect blend of aromatic and rich herbs and spices that seasons and flavors the kofta meat perfectly.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe you can try:

**Easy Kofta Curry**

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Kofta Recipe Mix (follow the package instructions for the amount)
2. 500g ground beef or lamb
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 cup breadcrumbs
6. 1 egg
7. 1 can (400g) chopped tomatoes
8. 1 can (400g) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
9. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
10. 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
11. 1 teaspoon coriander seeds
12. 1 teaspoon turmeric
13. 1 teaspoon chili powder (optional)
14. Salt to taste
15. Fresh cilantro for garnish
16. 2 cups water
17. 1 can (400ml) coconut milk

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the Kofta Recipe Mix, ground meat, chopped onion, minced garlic, breadcrumbs, and egg. Mix until well combined.
2. Shape the mixture into small oval or cylindrical balls (about 2 inches in diameter). Set aside.
3. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and coriander seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
4. Add the kofta balls to the pot and cook until lightly browned on all sides. Remove the kofta from the pot and set aside.
5. In the same pot, add the chopped tomatoes, chickpeas, turmeric, chili powder (if using), and salt. Stir well and cook for 5 minutes.
6. Add water and bring the mixture to a boil. Once boiling, reduce heat to low, add the browned kofta balls, and simmer for 20-30 minutes.
7. Stir in the coconut milk and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
8. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

Enjoy your Easy Kofta Curry! Keep in mind that you may need to adjust the ingredients or cooking times based on your personal taste preferences or the specific Kofta Recipe Mix you're using.

Description: Indulge in traditional Delhi Nihari from the comfort of your home using National Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix; which is prepared by Pakistani cuisine experts; using the ultimate blend of spices and herbs.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe using Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix from National Foods. Please note that you'll need some additional ingredients to complete the dish.

Delhi Nihari with National Foods Recipe Mix

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix (1 packet)
2. 1 kg boneless beef (cut into 1-inch cubes)
3. 1 liter of water
4. 2 large onions (finely chopped)
5. 5 cloves of garlic (minced)
6. 1-inch piece of ginger (grated)
7. 2 green chilies (slit)
8. 2 tbsp oil
9. 2 tbsp ghee (clarified butter)
10. Salt to taste
11. 2 tbsp lemon juice
12. Coriander leaves for garnish
13. Seedless dates for garnish (optional)

Instructions:
1. Wash the beef cubes thoroughly and set aside.
2. Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the beef cubes and fry until they are browned on all sides. Remove the beef from the pot and set aside.
3. In the same pot, add ghee. Once it's hot, add the chopped onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger. Sauté until the onions are golden brown.
4. Add the slit green chilies to the pot and stir for a minute.
5. Now, add the Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix to the pot. Stir well to ensure it's evenly distributed.
6. Pour water into the pot and mix well. Bring the mixture to a boil.
7. Once boiling, add the browned beef cubes back into the pot. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 1.5 to 2 hours, or until the beef is tender and the gravy has thickened. Stir occasionally to prevent burning.
8. Season with salt to taste. Add lemon juice and stir well.
9. Garnish with coriander leaves and seedless dates (if using).
10. Serve hot with rice or naan bread.

Enjoy your Delhi Nihari! Keep in mind that the cooking time may vary depending on the size and cut of the beef cubes. Always ensure that the beef is fully cooked before serving.
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Delhi Nihari Recipe Mix (1 packet)

Description: Indulge in a traditional BBQ by making delicious mouth watering tikka with National Tikka Boti Masala. A tantalizing blend of spices and fragrant herbs that helps make the meat tender and juicy. Now you can enjoy your favourite Tikka recipe at home without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Here's a simple Tikka Boti recipe using the Tikka Boti Recipe Mix from National Foods:

Ingredients:
1. 500g boneless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch cubes
2. 1 packet of National Foods Tikka Boti Recipe Mix
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2-3 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 inch ginger, grated
6. 2 green chilies, slit
7. 2 tomatoes, finely chopped
8. 1 tsp coriander powder
9. 1 tsp cumin powder
10. 1 tsp red chili powder (optional)
11. 1 tsp garam masala
12. 2 tbsp oil
13. Salt to taste
14. 2 tbsp fresh coriander leaves, chopped
15. 2 tbsp yogurt (optional)

Instructions:
1. Rinse the chicken cubes under cold water and pat dry with a paper towel.
2. In a bowl, mix the chicken cubes with half the packet of Tikka Boti Recipe Mix, salt, and yogurt (if using). Let it marinate for at least 30 minutes, or overnight for best results.
3. Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat. Add the marinated chicken cubes and cook until they are browned on all sides. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
4. In the same pan, add onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until the onions are translucent.
5. Add green chilies and tomatoes to the pan. Cook until the tomatoes are soft and mushy.
6. Add the remaining Tikka Boti Recipe Mix, coriander powder, cumin powder, red chili powder (if using), and garam masala to the pan. Stir well to coat the vegetables.
7. Add the cooked chicken back into the pan. Stir well to combine with the vegetables and spices. Cook for another 5 minutes.
8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Tikka Boti with rice or naan bread!
Ingredients: 2. 1 packet of National Foods Tikka Boti Recipe Mix

Description: Indulge in a traditional BBQ by using National’s Bihari Kabab Mix to create signature Bihari style kebabs with the perfect blend of hot spices for a delicious marinade. Now you can enjoy spicy, delicious Bihari Style BBQ meat without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Here's a simple Seekh Kabab recipe using the Seekh Kabab Recipe Mix from National Foods:

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Seekh Kabab Recipe Mix (1 packet)
2. 500g of minced lamb or mutton
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
5. 1 inch ginger, grated
6. 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional)
7. 1 egg
8. 1 tsp garam masala
9. Salt to taste
10. Oil for frying
11. Skewers (soaked in water for at least 30 minutes)

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the minced meat, finely chopped onions, minced garlic, grated ginger, and green chili (if using).
2. Add the contents of the National Foods Seekh Kabab Recipe Mix packet to the meat mixture.
3. Beat the egg in a separate bowl, then add it to the meat mixture and mix well until all the ingredients are thoroughly combined.
4. Season the mixture with salt and garam masala, then mix again.
5. Shape the meat mixture into long, cylindrical shapes and thread them onto the soaked skewers.
6. Preheat a grill or griddle pan over medium-high heat. Brush the skewers with oil.
7. Place the skewers on the grill or griddle pan and cook for about 5-6 minutes on each side, or until the kababs are cooked through and slightly charred.
8. Serve the Seekh Kababs hot with naan bread, rice, or your favorite side dish.

Enjoy your Seekh Kababs!
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Seekh Kabab Recipe Mix (1 packet)
11. Skewers (soaked in water for at least 30 minutes)

Description: Indulge in a traditional desi BBQ by using National’s Chicken Tandoori Mix to create signature tandoori with the perfect blend of hot spices for succulant and juicy chicken. Now you can enjoy authentic spicy and delicious chicken tandoori at home without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for Chicken Tandori using the National Foods Chicken Tandori Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 1 kg (2.2 lbs) boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into pieces
2. 1 packet of National Foods Chicken Tandori Recipe Mix
3. 1 cup of yogurt
4. 2-3 tablespoons of oil
5. 2-3 cloves of garlic, minced
6. 1 inch piece of ginger, grated
7. 1-2 green chilies, finely chopped (optional, for spiciness)
8. Juice of 1 lemon
9. Salt to taste
10. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the chicken pieces, yogurt, garlic, ginger, green chilies, and salt. Mix well to ensure the chicken is well coated.
2. Add the contents of the Chicken Tandori Recipe Mix packet to the bowl and mix again. Make sure all the chicken pieces are well coated with the spice mix.
3. Cover the bowl and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours, or overnight for best results.
4. Preheat your oven to 200 degrees Celsius (400 degrees Fahrenheit).
5. Line a baking tray with aluminum foil and brush it with oil. Place the marinated chicken pieces on the tray, ensuring they are not overlapping.
6. Drizzle the lemon juice over the chicken and sprinkle a little oil on top.
7. Bake in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and the exterior is slightly charred.
8. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Chicken Tandori! Remember, you can adjust the spiciness by adding more or less green chilies, and you can also use chicken breasts or thighs, depending on your preference.
Ingredients: 1. 1 kg (2.2 lbs) boneless, skinless chicken breasts or thighs, cut into pieces
2. 1 packet of National Foods Chicken Tandori Recipe Mix

Description: Indulge in a traditional desi BBQ by using National’s Chicken Tikka Mix to create signature chicken tikka with the perfect blend of hot spices for succulant and juicy chicken. Now you can enjoy authentic spicy and delicious chicken tandoori at home without the extra hassle. This mix can be used as a seasoning or flavouring for other dishes like sandwiches, pasta and many more.
Recipe:
Here's a simple Chicken Tikka recipe using National Foods Chicken Tikka Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 500g Chicken Breast, cut into cubes
2. 1 packet of National Foods Chicken Tikka Recipe Mix
3. 1 cup of Greek Yogurt
4. 2 tablespoons of Vegetable Oil
5. 2 tablespoons of Lemon Juice
6. Salt to taste
7. Optional: Chopped coriander for garnish

Steps:
1. In a large bowl, mix the Chicken Tikka Recipe Mix, yogurt, vegetable oil, lemon juice, and salt. Make sure all the chicken cubes are well coated.
2. Marinate the chicken for at least 2 hours, or preferably overnight, in the refrigerator.
3. Preheat your grill or broiler. If using a grill, thread the chicken cubes onto skewers.
4. Grill or broil the chicken for about 5-7 minutes on each side, or until the chicken is fully cooked and slightly charred.
5. Once cooked, let the chicken rest for a few minutes before serving.
6. Garnish with chopped coriander before serving.

Enjoy your Chicken Tikka! Remember, you can always adjust the spice level to your liking by adding more or less Recipe Mix.
Ingredients: 2. 1 packet of National Foods Chicken Tikka Recipe Mix

Description: Create your favourite spicy Fish recipe with the help of National Fish Recipe Mix. A blend of flavorful spices and fragrant herbs to make the perfect marination for any kind of fish. Helps in tenderizing and absorbing flavour. Perfect for fried, grilled and roasted fish.
Recipe:
A recipe you can make using National Foods Fish Recipe Mix is a "Spicy Fried Fish." Here's a simple recipe:

Ingredients:
1. 500g of your preferred fish fillets (like cod or hake), cut into bite-sized pieces
2. 1 packet of National Foods Fish Recipe Mix
3. 2 cups of vegetable oil for frying
4. Salt to taste
5. Lemon wedges and fresh coriander leaves for garnish (optional)

Instructions:
1. Rinse the fish fillets under cold water and pat dry with a kitchen towel. Season with a little salt.
2. In a large bowl, add the fish fillets and sprinkle the entire packet of National Foods Fish Recipe Mix over them. Make sure each piece is well coated.
3. Heat the vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or wok over medium-high heat. The oil is ready when a drop of water sizzles and pops.
4. Carefully add a few pieces of coated fish into the hot oil. Do not overcrowd the pan. Fry for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until the fish is golden brown and crispy.
5. Remove the fried fish from the oil and drain on a paper towel-lined plate. Repeat with the remaining fish pieces.
6. Serve the spicy fried fish hot, garnished with lemon wedges and fresh coriander leaves if desired.

Enjoy your meal! Remember, you can adjust the spiciness of the recipe by adding more or less chili powder in the Fish Recipe Mix.
Ingredients: 1. 500g of preferred fish fillets (like cod or hake), cut into bite-sized pieces
2. 1 packet of National Foods Fish Recipe Mix
3. 2 cups of vegetable oil for frying

Description: National’s Shami Kabab Recipe Mix helps you prepare delicious shami Kababs at home with the perfect blend mix of spices and herbs to give you that authentic flavour. Now you can enjoy home made spicy, mouth watering Shami Kababs without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe using National Foods Shami Kabab:

**Shami Kabab with National Foods Shami Kabab**

Ingredients:
1. 1 pack of National Foods Shami Kabab (approximately 450g)
2. 1 large onion, finely chopped
3. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
4. 1 inch ginger, grated
5. 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional, for spice)
6. 1 egg
7. 2-3 tbsp breadcrumbs
8. 2 tbsp oil for frying
9. Coriander leaves for garnish
10. Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. Thaw the National Foods Shami Kabab according to the package instructions. Once thawed, crumble the Shami Kabab into a large bowl.
2. Add the finely chopped onion, minced garlic, grated ginger, and chopped green chili (if using) to the bowl. Mix well to combine with the Shami Kabab.
3. Crack the egg into the bowl and mix it in. The egg acts as a binder to help the Shami Kabab hold its shape when fried.
4. Add breadcrumbs to the mixture. This will help in binding the Shami Kabab better and also give it a nice crust when fried. Add breadcrumbs until the mixture is no longer sticky.
5. Season with salt to taste.
6. Shape the mixture into small patties. You can make them as big or small as you like, but smaller patties will cook faster.
7. Heat oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, carefully place the Shami Kabab patties into the pan.
8. Fry the Shami Kabab on both sides until they are golden brown and crispy. This should take about 3-4 minutes per side.
9. Once done, drain the Shami Kabab on a paper towel to remove excess oil.
10. Garnish with coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Shami Kabab with National Foods Shami Kabab! You can serve it with rice, roti, or naan, and a side of raita or chutney.

Description: Prepare delicious crispy and spicy coating for your broast with National Broast Batter Mix Masala. Incredibly easy to prepare and cook. Flavorsome spices and herbs blended in a batter mix that coats the meat to perfection and brings out the classic broast look and taste at home in a matter of minutes. Serve it with fries and National’s Garlic Mayo to enhance the eating experience.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for Broasted Chicken using National Foods Broast Recipe Mix:

Ingredients:
1. 4-5 pounds of whole chicken, cut into pieces (breasts, legs, wings, and drums)
2. 1 1/2 cups of National Foods Broast Recipe Mix
3. 2 cups of water
4. Vegetable oil for frying

Instructions:
1. Rinse the chicken pieces under cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Set aside.
2. In a large bowl, combine the Broast Recipe Mix and water. Stir until the mix is completely dissolved.
3. Submerge the chicken pieces in the mixture, making sure they are fully coated. Let them soak for at least 30 minutes, or up to 2 hours for a more intense flavor.
4. Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. If you don't have a deep fryer, you can also use a large, deep pot with at least 4 inches of oil.
5. Carefully place the coated chicken pieces into the hot oil, being careful not to overcrowd the pot. Fry for 12-15 minutes, or until the chicken is golden brown and cooked through. Make sure to turn the pieces over halfway through the cooking time.
6. Remove the chicken from the oil and drain on paper towels. Season with salt if desired.
7. Serve the Broasted Chicken hot, with your choice of sides.

Enjoy your meal! Remember, you can always adjust the ingredients to your taste. If you want the chicken to be spicier, you can add some cayenne pepper to the Broast Recipe Mix. If you prefer a milder flavor, you can use less of the mix or use less water when mixing it.
Ingredients: 1. 4-5 pounds of whole chicken, cut into pieces (breasts, legs, wings, and drums)
2. 1 1/2 cups of National Foods Broast Recipe Mix

Description: Indulge in a traditional BBQ by using National’s Chapli Kabab Mix to create signature kebabs with the perfect blend of hot spices for delicious tender meat. Now you can enjoy authentic spicy and delicious chapli kebabs at home without the extra hassle.
Recipe:
Here's a simple Chapli Kabab recipe using the Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix from National Foods:

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix (1 packet)
2. 500g Minced Meat (Beef or Lamb)
3. 1 Large Onion, finely chopped
4. 2-3 Green Chilies, finely chopped
5. 2 cloves Garlic, minced
6. 1 inch Ginger, grated
7. 1 Egg
8. 2-3 tablespoons Oil
9. Salt to taste
10. Water as required

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix the Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix with the minced meat.
2. Add the finely chopped onion, green chilies, minced garlic, and grated ginger to the bowl.
3. Beat an egg and add it to the mixture.
4. Season with salt to your taste.
5. Gradually add water to the mixture, a tablespoon at a time, until the mixture holds together but is not too wet.
6. Using your hands, shape the mixture into flat, round patties.
7. Heat oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
8. Place the Chapli Kabab patties in the pan and cook until they are golden brown on both sides. This usually takes about 3-4 minutes per side.
9. Once cooked, drain the excess oil on a paper towel.
10. Serve the Chapli Kababs hot with your favorite side dishes.

Enjoy your Chapli Kababs! Remember, you can always adjust the ingredients to your taste. Happy cooking!
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Chapli Kabab Recipe Mix (1 packet)

Description: Looking for a convenient Haleem Mix with an authentic Haleem flavor? Look no further than National\’s Quick Cook Haleem. This recipe mix is a blend of spices and lentils that will help you cook traditional Haleem in no time.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe using Quick Cook Haleem from National Foods:

**Quick Cook Haleem One-Pot Meal**

Ingredients:
1. 1 pack (600g) of National Foods Quick Cook Haleem
2. 4 cups of water
3. 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
4. 1 large onion, finely chopped
5. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
6. 1 inch piece of ginger, grated
7. 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
8. 1 teaspoon coriander seeds
9. 2 green chilies, slit
10. 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
11. Salt to taste
12. 1 cup of chopped mixed vegetables (like carrots, peas, and corn) (optional)
13. 1 cup of chopped nuts (like almonds and cashews) (optional)
14. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
15. Lemon wedges for serving

Instructions:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds. Let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add the chopped onion, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until the onion turns golden brown.
4. Add the green chilies and turmeric powder. Stir for a minute.
5. Add the Quick Cook Haleem and mix well with the onion mixture.
6. Pour in 4 cups of water and stir well. If you're using vegetables or nuts, add them now.
7. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender if you're using them.
8. Season with salt to taste.
9. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with lemon wedges.

Enjoy your Quick Cook Haleem!
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Quick Cook Haleem (600g pack)

Description: Prepare delicious authentic Haleem with National. A blend of spices, lentils mix and your choice of meat, stirred and cooked to perfection to make this wholesome meal for any event.
Recipe:
Here's a simple Haleem recipe using National Foods Haleem Recipe Mix. Please note that you'll need to adjust the quantities based on the size of your serving.

Ingredients:
1. National Foods Haleem Recipe Mix (follow package instructions for amount)
2. 2 cups of water
3. 2 cups of cooked lentils (chana dal or toor dal)
4. 2 cups of cooked meat (like mutton or chicken, optional)
5. 2 medium-sized onions, finely chopped
6. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
7. 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
8. 2 green chilies, finely chopped (optional, for spice)
9. 1 tablespoon ghee or oil
10. Salt to taste
11. 2 tablespoons of finely chopped coriander leaves for garnish
12. Water as needed (for cooking)

Instructions:
1. Heat ghee or oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.
2. Add the green chilies (if using) and sauté for a minute.
3. Add the Haleem Recipe Mix to the pot and stir well to combine with the onion mixture.
4. Add 2 cups of water and stir until the mix is well combined. Bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Once boiling, reduce heat to low and let it simmer for about 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
6. Add the cooked lentils and meat (if using) to the pot. Stir well to combine.
7. If the mixture is too thick, add more water as needed to reach your desired consistency.
8. Season with salt and let it simmer for another 10-15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
10. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.
11. Serve hot with raita or lemon wedges.

Enjoy your homemade Haleem!
Ingredients: 3. 2 cups of cooked lentils (chana dal or toor dal)
4. 2 cups of cooked meat (like mutton or chicken, optional)
8. 2 green chilies, finely chopped (optional, for spice)
11. 2 tablespoons of finely chopped coriander leaves for garnish

Description: Get the familiar taste of Traditional Daighi Danedar Haleem with National. A blend of spices, lentils mix and your choice of meat, stirred to perfection to make the ideal traditional meal for any event.
Recipe:
Here's a simple Daali Danedar Haleem recipe using Daagi Danedar Haleem Recipe Mix from National Foods. Please note that you'll need to add some additional ingredients to make it complete.

Ingredients:
1. Daagi Danedar Haleem Recipe Mix (1 packet, approximately 350g)
2. Water (4 cups)
3. Ghee or vegetable oil (2 tablespoons)
4. Onions (1 medium, finely chopped)
5. Garlic (2 cloves, minced)
6. Green chilies (2, finely chopped)
7. Tomatoes (2 medium, finely chopped)
8. Salt to taste
9. Garam Masala (1 teaspoon)
10. Chili powder (1 teaspoon)
11. Cumin seeds (1 teaspoon)
12. Boiled chickpeas (1 cup)
13. Boiled lentils (1 cup)
14. Roasted chana (1/2 cup)
15. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and fried onions

Instructions:
1. In a large pot, heat ghee or vegetable oil over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
2. Add finely chopped onions and sauté until they turn golden brown.
3. Add minced garlic and green chilies and sauté for a minute.
4. Add finely chopped tomatoes and cook until they soften.
5. Add salt, garam masala, and chili powder. Stir well.
6. Add Daagi Danedar Haleem Recipe Mix to the pot. Mix it well with the onion, tomato, and spice mix.
7. Gradually add 4 cups of water to the pot. Stir well to avoid lumps.
8. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
9. Once the mixture has thickened, add boiled chickpeas, lentils, and roasted chana. Stir well.
10. Cook for another 5 minutes.
11. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and fried onions before serving.

Enjoy your Daali Danedar Haleem!

Description: Are you tired of cooking repetitive Sabzi recipes with the same ordinary taste? Add a burst of flavor and irresistible aroma by using National Chatkharaydaar Sabzi Recipe Mix and amaze your family. Used and recommended by Pakistani cuisine experts; the Chatkharaydaar Sabzi Recipe mix adds a tangy twist to your vegetarian dishes. Just one sachet prepares a delicious meal for your entire family of 5-6 people.Get your Rozana box now, that contains 2 sachets of Rozana Recipes and a whole load of tangy, spicy goodness.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe you can follow:

**Chatkharaydaar Sabzi Recipe**

Ingredients:
1. Chatkharaydaar Sabzi Recipe Mix - 1 packet (contains turmeric, chili, coriander, cumin, and other spices)
2. Vegetables (like carrots, cauliflower, French beans, peas, and potatoes) - 2 cups, cut into bite-sized pieces
3. Oil - 2 tablespoons
4. Water - 1.5 cups
5. Salt to taste
6. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish (optional)

Steps:
1. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat.
2. Add the vegetables to the pan and sauté for a few minutes until they start to soften.
3. Add the contents of the Chatkharaydaar Sabzi Recipe Mix packet to the pan. Stir well to coat the vegetables evenly.
4. Add water and salt to the pan. Bring the mixture to a boil.
5. Reduce heat, cover the pan, and let it simmer until the vegetables are tender. This should take about 10-15 minutes.
6. Stir occasionally to prevent the vegetables from sticking to the bottom of the pan.
7. Once the vegetables are cooked, turn off the heat. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves if desired.
8. Serve hot with roti, rice, or any other Indian bread.

Enjoy your Chatkharaydaar Sabzi!
Ingredients: 2. Vegetables (carrots, cauliflower, French beans, peas, potatoes)

Description: Are you tired of cooking repetitive recipes with the same ordinary taste? Add a burst of flavor and irresistible aroma by using National Mazedaar Daal Recipe Mix and amaze your family. Used and recommended by Pakistani cuisine experts; the Mazedaar Daal Recipe mix is prepared with a special taste of chicken flavour to enhance your meal. Just one sachet prepares a delicious meal for your entire family of 5-6 people.Get your Rozana box now, that contains 2 sachets of Rozana Recipes and a whole load of flavour and spicy goodness.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe using Mazedaar Daal Recipe Mix from National Foods. This is a one-pot lentil curry that's quick and easy to prepare.

Ingredients:
1. Mazedaar Daal Recipe Mix (1 packet, about 200g)
2. 4 cups of water
3. 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil
4. 1 medium-sized onion, finely chopped
5. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
6. 1 inch piece of ginger, grated
7. 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional, for spiciness)
8. 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
9. 1 teaspoon coriander seeds
10. 1/2 teaspoon turmeric powder
11. Salt to taste
12. 2 tablespoons of lemon juice
13. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat.
2. Add the cumin seeds and coriander seeds. Once they start to sizzle, add the chopped onion, garlic, ginger, and green chili (if using). Sauté until the onion is translucent.
3. Add the Mazedaar Daal Recipe Mix to the pot and stir well to coat it with the oil and spices.
4. Pour in 4 cups of water and stir well. Add turmeric powder and salt.
5. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the lentils are tender.
6. Once the daal is cooked, stir in the lemon juice. Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed.
7. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Mazedaar Daal! This dish is typically served with rice or flatbread, like roti or naan.

Description: Add a unique flavor and irresistible savour to your dishes with the help of National Turmeric Powder. The rich yellow color; tempting aroma and fine texture makes this the perfect ingredient to add in your delicacies for a burst of flavor.
Recipe:
Here's a simple and delicious Turmeric Golden Milk recipe for you:

Ingredients:
1. 1 cup of almond milk (or any other plant-based milk of your preference)
2. 1 teaspoon of Turmeric Powder from National Foods
3. 1 teaspoon of honey (or any other natural sweetener of your choice)
4. A small piece of fresh ginger (about 1 inch long, peeled and sliced)
5. A pinch of black pepper (this enhances the bioavailability of turmeric)
6. A pinch of cinnamon (optional, for added flavor)

Instructions:
1. In a small saucepan, combine the almond milk, turmeric powder, honey, ginger, and black pepper.
2. Heat the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until it just begins to simmer.
3. Remove from heat and let it steep for a few minutes to allow the flavors to meld together.
4. Strain the mixture to remove the ginger pieces. You can choose to leave them in if you prefer a stronger ginger flavor.
5. If you like, you can sprinkle a pinch of cinnamon on top before serving.
6. Enjoy your Golden Milk warm!

This recipe is not only delicious but also packed with health benefits due to the turmeric and ginger. Enjoy your cooking!
Ingredients: 2. 1 teaspoon of Turmeric Powder from National Foods
4. 1 inch long piece of fresh ginger, peeled and sliced

Description: National Foods provides you with the finest and most exquisite seasonings and condiments. National Garam Masala is a blend of premium spices which gives a unique flavor and irresistible aroma to your dishes.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for Chicken Curry using Garam Masala from National Foods as an example.

Ingredients:
1. 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
2. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
3. 1 large onion, finely chopped
4. 2 cloves garlic, minced
5. 1 inch piece of ginger, grated
6. 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional, for heat)
7. 2 tablespoons National Foods Garam Masala
8. 1 can (400g) diced tomatoes
9. 1 can (400g) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
10. 1 can (400g) coconut milk
11. Salt to taste
12. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are browned on all sides. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside.
2. In the same pan, add the onions, garlic, ginger, and green chili. Sauté until the onions are translucent.
3. Add the Garam Masala to the pan and stir well to coat the onions. Cook for about 30 seconds.
4. Add the diced tomatoes, chickpeas, and salt to the pan. Stir well and let it simmer for about 5 minutes.
5. Add the browned chicken and coconut milk to the pan. Stir well and let it simmer for about 20 minutes, or until the chicken is fully cooked and the sauce has thickened.
6. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Chicken Curry with rice or naan bread!

Description: National’s Chilli Powder adds the perfect amount of pungency and hotness to your dishes and gives them a burst of flavor. Made from pure and fresh spices, gives this a natural red color. The spiciness will enhance the taste of your dishes, especially Pakistani cuisines.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for Chilli Con Carne, a popular Mexican dish:

Ingredients:
1. 500g of lean minced beef
2. 1 large onion, finely chopped
3. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
4. 1 can of chopped tomatoes (400g)
5. 1 can of red kidney beans (400g), drained and rinsed
6. 2 tablespoons of National Foods Chilli Powder
7. 1 teaspoon of ground cumin
8. 1 teaspoon of salt
9. 1 tablespoon of vegetable oil
10. 1 cup of water
11. Optional: 1 tablespoon of tomato paste, 1 bell pepper, diced, 1 can of corn (400g), drained

Instructions:
1. Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the minced beef and cook until browned. Remove the beef from the pan and set aside.
2. In the same pan, add the onion and garlic. Cook until the onion is softened.
3. Add the National Foods Chilli Powder, cumin, and salt to the pan. Stir well to coat the onion and garlic.
4. Return the cooked beef to the pan. Add the can of chopped tomatoes, kidney beans, water, and optional tomato paste. If you're using bell pepper and corn, add them now.
5. Stir well, bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Let it simmer for at least 20 minutes, or until the flavors have melded together.
6. Taste and adjust the seasoning if necessary. Serve the Chilli Con Carne hot, over rice or with tortilla chips.

Enjoy your meal! Remember, you can always adjust the amount of chilli powder to suit your taste.
Ingredients: 5. 1 can of red kidney beans (400g), drained and rinsed
6. 2 tablespoons of National Foods Chilli Powder
11. Optional: 1 tablespoon of tomato paste, 1 bell pepper, diced, 1 can of corn (400g), drained.

Description: Give your dishes a burst of flavor and an enticing aroma. National Ginger Powder is made from premium quality natural ginger; without any artificial colors and flavors. Our fine textured Ginger Powder is a healthy choice to add in your food due to its antioxidant and anti-inflammatory properties.
Recipe:
Here's a simple and delicious recipe for Ginger Tea using National Foods Ginger Powder.

Ingredients:
1. 1 teaspoon of National Foods Ginger Powder
2. 1 cup of water
3. 1 tablespoon of honey (optional, for sweetness)
4. Lemon slice (optional, for flavor)

Instructions:
1. Boil 1 cup of water in a saucepan.
2. Once the water is boiling, reduce the heat to low and add 1 teaspoon of National Foods Ginger Powder. Stir well to dissolve the ginger powder.
3. Let the mixture simmer for about 5 minutes.
4. If you prefer a sweeter taste, you can add 1 tablespoon of honey at this stage and stir until it's fully dissolved.
5. Strain the ginger tea into a cup to remove any solids.
6. Squeeze the juice of half a lemon into the cup for an extra flavor boost (this is optional).
7. Your Ginger Tea is now ready to enjoy!

Enjoy your homemade Ginger Tea! It's not only delicious but also has numerous health benefits due to the anti-inflammatory and antioxidant properties of ginger.

Description:
Pure and freshly ground, National Coriander Powder is a fragrant, antioxidant-rich herb that adds a mild flavour and a pleasing aroma to savoury foods.
National ensures that you get the purest spices by only selecting the finest raw materials and carefully packaging them under strict hygienic conditions, ensuring quality at every step of the process following international and GMP standards.
National Coriander Powder comes packaged in a bag and sealed in a box.
Recipe:
A simple and delicious recipe using Coriander Powder from National Foods is Chicken Tikka Masala. Here's a basic recipe for you:

Ingredients:
1. 500g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
2. 3 tablespoons natural yogurt
3. 2 tablespoons lemon juice
4. 2 tablespoons Coriander Powder from National Foods
5. 1 teaspoon Cumin Powder
6. 1 teaspoon Paprika
7. 1 teaspoon Garam Masala
8. 1 teaspoon Salt
9. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
10. 1 large onion, finely chopped
11. 3 cloves garlic, minced
12. 1-inch piece of ginger, grated
13. 1 can (400g) chopped tomatoes
14. 1 can (200g) chopped tomato puree
15. 1 tablespoon Tomato Paste
16. 2 green chilies, finely chopped
17. 1 tablespoon sugar
18. 1 teaspoon Tumeric Powder
19. 1 teaspoon Red Chili Powder
20. 200ml single cream
21. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish
22. Naan bread or basmati rice to serve

Instructions:
1. In a bowl, mix the chicken with yogurt, lemon juice, Coriander Powder, Cumin Powder, Paprika, Garam Masala, and salt. Marinate for at least 30 minutes, or up to 24 hours in the fridge.
2. Preheat your oven to 200°C (180°C fan) or gas mark 6. Thread the marinated chicken pieces onto skewers and grill for 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until cooked through. Alternatively, you can cook the chicken in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat until browned and cooked through. Set aside.
3. Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger, and cook until softened.
4. Add the chopped tomatoes, tomato puree, tomato paste, green chilies, sugar, Tumeric Powder, and Red Chili Powder to the pan. Stir well and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes, until the sauce has thickened.
5. Add the cooked chicken to the pan and stir well to coat with the sauce. Cook for a few minutes to heat through.
6. Stir in the single cream and season with salt if needed. Simmer for a few more minutes.
7. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve with naan bread or basmati rice.

Enjoy your Chicken Tikka Masala! Remember, you can adjust the spices to your taste. Enjoy cooking!
Ingredients: 4. 2 tablespoons Coriander Powder from National Foods

Description: National Foods provides you with the finest and most exquisite seasonings and condiments. National’s Cumin Seeds are loaded with antioxidants and nutrients that are beneficial for your health. Make your dishes more flavorsome and aromatic with the help of our Cumin Seeds.
Recipe:
Here's a simple and delicious recipe for Cumin Seed Roasted Chickpeas. This recipe uses Cumin Seeds from National Foods.

Ingredients:
1. 2 cans (15 oz each) of chickpeas, drained and rinsed
2. 2 tablespoons of Cumin Seeds from National Foods
3. 2 tablespoons of Olive Oil
4. 1 teaspoon of Salt
5. 1/2 teaspoon of Black Pepper

Instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 400 degrees Fahrenheit (204 degrees Celsius).
2. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
3. In a bowl, combine drained and rinsed chickpeas, cumin seeds, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Make sure the chickpeas are well coated with the spices and oil.
4. Spread the chickpeas evenly on the baking sheet.
5. Roast in the preheated oven for about 40-45 minutes, stirring every 15 minutes to ensure they don't burn.
6. Once they're golden-brown, remove from the oven and let them cool.
7. Enjoy your roasted chickpeas as a snack or use them as a topping for salads or rice bowls.

Description: This multi-purpose herb provides a fragrant aroma and rich flavor by transforming your meals by adding a sweetness and depth of flavour to any dish. Typically, Kasuri Methi pairs well with potatoes and is used to make “Aloo Methi”. It is also used in doughs for Parathas and Naan and is sprinkled over curries with meat.
Recipe:
Here's a simple and delicious recipe for a dish called "Kasuri Methi Paneer" (Kasuri Methi with cottage cheese).

Ingredients:
1. 200 grams of Paneer (cottage cheese)
2. 3 tablespoons of Kasuri Methi (National Foods)
3. 2 medium-sized onions, finely chopped
4. 2 medium-sized tomatoes, finely chopped
5. 2 green chilies, finely chopped
6. 1 teaspoon of cumin seeds
7. 1 teaspoon of turmeric powder
8. 1 tablespoon of coriander powder
9. 1 teaspoon of red chili powder (adjust according to your spice tolerance)
10. 1 tablespoon of oil
11. Salt to taste
12. 2 tablespoons of chopped coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Crumble the paneer into small pieces and set aside.
2. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds.
3. Add the chopped onions to the pan and sauté until they turn soft and golden brown.
4. Add the chopped green chilies and tomatoes to the pan. Sauté until the tomatoes are soft and the mixture is well combined.
5. Add the turmeric powder, coriander powder, and red chili powder to the pan. Stir well to ensure the spices are evenly distributed.
6. Add the crumbled paneer to the pan and mix well. Cook for a few minutes until the paneer is well coated with the spice mixture.
7. Add the crushed Kasuri Methi to the pan and stir well. Cook for another minute or two, ensuring that the Kasuri Methi is well mixed into the dish.
8. Season with salt to taste.
9. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Kasuri Methi Paneer! This dish is often served with roti (Indian flatbread) or rice.
Ingredients: 9. Red chili powder - 1 teaspoon (adjust according to spice tolerance)

Description: National Foods Limited is the pioneer of branded spices in clean packaged form in Pakistan. We ensure that you get the purest spices by selecting only the finest raw materials and maintaining strict quality control at our state-of-the art manufacturing facilities. National Black Pepper gives the perfect hot flavor to your dishes.
Recipe:
A simple and delicious recipe using National Foods Black Pepper Powder is Black Pepper Chicken. Here's the recipe:

Ingredients:
1. 500 grams of boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces
2. 3 tablespoons of National Foods Vegetable Oil
3. 3 cloves of garlic, minced
4. 1 medium-sized onion, finely chopped
5. 2 tablespoons of National Foods Black Pepper Powder
6. 1 tablespoon of soy sauce
7. 1 tablespoon of honey
8. 1 tablespoon of cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons of water (for thickening)
9. Salt to taste
10. 2 green chilies (optional)
11. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat.
2. Add the chicken pieces and cook until they are browned and fully cooked. Remove the chicken from the skillet and set aside.
3. In the same skillet, add another tablespoon of vegetable oil. Add the minced garlic and chopped onion, and sauté until they are soft and fragrant.
4. Add the National Foods Black Pepper Powder, soy sauce, and honey to the skillet. Stir well to combine.
5. Return the cooked chicken to the skillet and stir to coat it with the pepper sauce.
6. Add the cornstarch slurry to the skillet and stir until the sauce thickens.
7. Season with salt to taste. If you like your food spicy, you can add sliced green chilies at this stage.
8. Cook for another 2-3 minutes to let the flavors meld together.
9. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Black Pepper Chicken! It pairs well with rice or noodles.
Ingredients: 2. 3 tablespoons of National Foods Vegetable Oil
5. 2 tablespoons of National Foods Black Pepper Powder

Description: National Garlic Powder is a great addition to make your dishes exceedingly appetizing and aromatic. Our fine textured Garlic Powder is the perfect choice to add to your cooking because it enhances the overall flavour of your dish.
Recipe:
A simple and delicious recipe using Garlic Powder from National Foods is Garlic Bread. Here's a simple recipe for you:

Garlic Bread Recipe:

Ingredients:
1. 1 loaf of Italian bread
2. 1/2 cup of unsalted butter, softened
3. 2 teaspoons of Garlic Powder from National Foods
4. 2 teaspoons of dried parsley
5. 1/2 teaspoon of salt (optional, depending on your taste)
6. 2 cloves of garlic (optional, for extra garlic flavor)

Steps:
1. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the softened butter, Garlic Powder, dried parsley, and salt. If you prefer a stronger garlic flavor, you can also mince and add 2 cloves of garlic to this mixture.
3. Microwave the butter mixture for about 30 seconds until the butter is melted. Stir until the ingredients are well combined.
4. Cut the loaf of bread into slices, but not all the way through. You want the slices to be connected at the bottom.
5. Brush the garlic butter mixture generously between the slices of bread.
6. Wrap the bread in aluminum foil.
7. Bake in the preheated oven for 10-15 minutes, or until the bread is toasted and the garlic butter is melted and fragrant.
8. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your homemade Garlic Bread!
Ingredients: 3. 2 teaspoons of Garlic Powder from National Foods

Description: National iodized Refined salt is a specially refined; brilliant white food grade salt with free flow properties. Enjoy great tasting and healthy food prepared with National iodized Refined Salt.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for homemade seasoned fries using Refined Salt:

Ingredients:
1. 4 large potatoes, washed and cut into fry shapes
2. 2-3 tablespoons of vegetable oil
3. 1 tablespoon of National Foods Refined Salt
4. 1 teaspoon of paprika
5. 1 teaspoon of garlic powder
6. 1/2 teaspoon of onion powder

Instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 220 degrees Celsius (428 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. In a large bowl, toss the potato fries with the vegetable oil until they're all evenly coated.
3. In a separate bowl, mix together the National Foods Refined Salt, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.
4. Sprinkle the seasoning mix over the fries and toss until they're evenly coated.
5. Spread the seasoned fries out on a baking sheet in a single layer.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until they're golden brown and crispy. Make sure to turn the fries halfway through to ensure they cook evenly.
7. Remove from the oven and let them cool for a minute or two before serving. Enjoy your homemade seasoned fries!
Ingredients: 3. National Foods Refined Salt (quantity not specified, assume 1 tablespoon is used in step 4)

Description: National iodized Salt is a specially refined; brilliant white food grade salt. It includes essential iodine which helps in the proper mental development of children and prevents iodine deficiency in adults.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for homemade bread that uses iodized refined salt:

**Recipe: Homemade Bread**

Ingredients:
1. 5 cups bread flour
2. 2 1/2 teaspoons iodized refined salt
3. 2 tablespoons sugar
4. 2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
5. 2 cups warm water (110°F to 115°F)
6. 2 tablespoons vegetable oil

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine 4 cups of flour, salt, sugar, and yeast. Make a well in the center.
2. Add warm water and vegetable oil to the well. Gradually mix the dry ingredients into the liquid until a soft dough forms. If the dough is too sticky, add more flour, 1 tablespoon at a time.
3. Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 to 7 minutes.
4. Place the dough in a greased bowl, cover with a clean kitchen towel, and let it rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
5. Punch down the dough and turn it out onto a floured surface. Shape into a loaf and place in a greased 9x5-inch loaf pan.
6. Cover with a clean kitchen towel and let it rise again until nearly doubled in size, about 30 to 45 minutes.
7. Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C) with a rack in the lower third.
8. Bake the bread for 30 to 35 minutes, or until golden brown and the loaf sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom. Remove from the pan and let cool on a wire rack.

Enjoy your homemade bread! Remember to use the iodized refined salt as specified in the recipe for optimal nutritional benefits.

Description: National Iodized Salt is a specially refined; food grade salt. It includes essential Iodine which helps in the proper mental development of children and prevents Iodine deficiency in adults.
Recipe:
A simple recipe you can make using Iodized Pink Himalayan Salt is a simple Grilled Chicken Breast. Here's a simple recipe:

Ingredients:
1. 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts
2. 2 tablespoons of olive oil
3. 1 teaspoon of Iodized Pink Himalayan Salt
4. 1 teaspoon of black pepper
5. 1 teaspoon of garlic powder
6. 1 teaspoon of paprika
7. 1 lemon, cut into wedges

Instructions:
1. Preheat your grill to medium-high heat.
2. In a bowl, mix together the Iodized Pink Himalayan Salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and paprika.
3. Brush the chicken breasts with olive oil on both sides.
4. Coat the chicken breasts evenly with the salt and spice mixture on both sides.
5. Place the chicken breasts on the grill and cook for 6-7 minutes on each side, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
6. Serve the grilled chicken breasts with lemon wedges.

Enjoy your meal! Remember, the salt is there to enhance the flavor, so use it sparingly, especially if you're sensitive to salt.
Ingredients: 3. 1 teaspoon of Iodized Pink Himalayan Salt

Description: National tomato ketchup is prepared using the finest tomatoes that give it, its signature thick and delicious taste! The perfect accompaniment for all your snacks and meals, National ketchup is made from premium ingredients without any artificial colours or flavourings. All our products are carefully packaged under strict hygienic conditions, ensuring quality at every step of the process.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for Tomato Ketchup Chicken Wings using the National Foods Tomato Ketchup.

Ingredients:
1. 1 kg chicken wings
2. 1 cup National Foods Tomato Ketchup
3. 2 tablespoons soy sauce
4. 2 tablespoons vinegar
5. 1 tablespoon honey
6. 1 tablespoon minced garlic
7. 1 tablespoon chopped onion
8. 1 teaspoon ground black pepper
9. Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. Preheat your oven to 200 degrees Celsius (392 degrees Fahrenheit).
2. In a bowl, mix together the tomato ketchup, soy sauce, vinegar, honey, minced garlic, chopped onion, and ground black pepper. Season with salt to taste.
3. Coat the chicken wings evenly with the sauce mixture.
4. Place the coated chicken wings on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
5. Bake in the preheated oven for about 45 minutes, turning the wings halfway through to ensure they're evenly cooked.
6. Once done, remove from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes before serving.

Enjoy your Tomato Ketchup Chicken Wings! Remember, you can always adjust the ingredients to your liking. Have fun cooking!

Description: National tomato ketchup is prepared using the finest tomatoes that give it, its signature thick and delicious taste! The perfect accompaniment for all your snacks and meals, National ketchup is made from premium ingredients without any artificial colours or flavourings. All our products are carefully packaged under strict hygienic conditions, ensuring quality at every step of the process.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for a classic dish using Tomato Ketchup:

Recipe: Tomato Ketchup Chicken Wings

Ingredients:
1. 1 kg Chicken Wings
2. Salt to taste
3. Black Pepper to taste
4. 1 cup All-purpose Flour
5. 2 cups Vegetable Oil for frying
6. 1 cup Tomato Ketchup
7. 2 tbsp Honey
8. 2 tbsp Vinegar
9. 1 tbsp Worcestershire Sauce
10. 2 cloves Garlic, minced
11. 1 tbsp Chili Sauce (optional, for extra heat)

Instructions:
1. Wash and dry the chicken wings. Season them with salt and black pepper.
2. Coat the chicken wings in flour, shaking off any excess.
3. Heat the vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or wok over medium-high heat. Fry the chicken wings until they are golden brown and crispy. Remove the fried wings from the oil and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
4. In a saucepan, combine the Tomato Ketchup, honey, vinegar, Worcestershire sauce, minced garlic, and chili sauce (if using). Stir to mix well.
5. Bring the sauce to a boil over medium heat, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for a few minutes, until it thickens.
6. Toss the fried chicken wings in the Tomato Ketchup sauce until they are well coated.
7. Serve the Tomato Ketchup Chicken Wings hot, with additional sauce on the side if desired. Enjoy!

Description: Savor the tantalizing combination of juicy red tomatoes; mingled with the taste of hot chilies and garlic. The perfect way to top off any meal specially BBQ, broast, samosas and rolls. Made with real garlic chunks, National Chilli Garlic Sauce is bound to entice your tastebuds with its perfectly delicious taste!
Recipe:
Here's a simple yet delicious recipe for Chilli Garlic Pasta using National Foods Chilli Garlic Sauce.

Ingredients:
1. 250g Spaghetti or any pasta of your choice
2. 3 tablespoons of National Foods Chilli Garlic Sauce
3. 2 tablespoons of olive oil
4. 2 cloves of garlic, minced
5. 1 small onion, finely chopped
6. 1 bell pepper (any color), sliced
7. 1 can (400g) of chopped tomatoes
8. Salt to taste
9. 1 tablespoon of sugar
10. 1 cup of water
11. 100g of feta cheese, crumbled
12. Fresh basil leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside.
2. Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add minced garlic and chopped onion, sauté until softened.
3. Add sliced bell pepper and sauté for another 2-3 minutes.
4. Stir in the National Foods Chilli Garlic Sauce and canned chopped tomatoes. Add salt and sugar to taste.
5. Pour in 1 cup of water and let it simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the sauce thickens.
6. Add the cooked pasta to the pan and stir well to coat it evenly with the sauce.
7. Remove from heat and stir in the crumbled feta cheese.
8. Garnish with fresh basil leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Chilli Garlic Pasta! Remember, you can always adjust the ingredients to your liking. If you prefer it spicier, you can add more chilli garlic sauce or even a bit of chili flakes. Enjoy your cooking!
Ingredients: 1. 250g Spaghetti or any pasta of your choice
2. 3 tablespoons of National Foods Chilli Garlic Sauce

Description: National Mixed Pickle is prepared with high quality ingredients including flavorsome oils, freshly picked succulent mixed vegetables and the perfect balance of spices to give it a delicious spicy and tangy flavor. It contains the perfect mix of vegetables including chatkharaydaar keri, green chillies, carrots and more, tossed in a delicious blend of aromatic spices. This is a favourite of all Pickle lovers, and is enjoyed thouroughly with traditional desi dishes.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for a Mixed Pickle Chaat. This recipe uses Mixed Pickle from National Foods as one of its main ingredients.

Ingredients:
1. 1 cup Mixed Pickle from National Foods (preferably the one with a mix of vegetables and fruits)
2. 1 cup boiled and peeled chickpeas (chana)
3. 1 cup puffed rice (muri)
4. 1 medium-sized onion, finely chopped
5. 1 green chili, finely chopped (optional, for spice)
6. 1 tbsp chopped coriander leaves (cilantro)
7. 1 tbsp chopped mint leaves
8. 1 tbsp chopped peanuts
9. 1 tbsp roasted gram (chana dal)
10. Juice of 1 lime
11. Salt to taste

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix the Mixed Pickle from National Foods, boiled chickpeas, and puffed rice.
2. Add the chopped onion, green chili (if using), coriander leaves, mint leaves, peanuts, and roasted gram.
3. Sprinkle salt to taste and squeeze the juice of 1 lime over the mixture.
4. Mix well to ensure all the ingredients are evenly coated with the pickle juice and lime juice.
5. Your Mixed Pickle Chaat is ready to be served. You can enjoy it as it is or with some chopped cucumber or tomato on top for an added crunch.
Ingredients: 1. Mixed Pickle from National Foods (preferably the one with a mix of vegetables and fruits)

Description: National Mango Pickle contains the goodness of tangy chatkharaydaar keri, tossed in the perfect blend of aromatic spices including red chillies, turmeric, aniseed, fenugreek seed and other savory ingredients. This is a favourite of all Pickle lovers, and is enjoyed thouroughly with traditional desi dishes.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for a Mango Pickle Chicken Curry:

Ingredients:
1. 500g Chicken Breast, cut into chunks
2. 200g Mango Pickle from National Foods
3. 2 medium-sized onions, finely chopped
4. 2-3 garlic cloves, minced
5. 1 inch ginger, grated
6. 2 green chilies, finely chopped
7. 1 tsp coriander powder
8. 1 tsp cumin powder
9. 1 tsp turmeric powder
10. 1 tsp red chili powder
11. 2 tbsp vegetable oil
12. Salt to taste
13. Fresh coriander leaves for garnish

Instructions:
1. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chopped onions, garlic, ginger, and green chilies. Sauté until the onions turn golden brown.
2. Add the chicken pieces to the pan and stir fry until they are slightly browned.
3. Add the coriander powder, cumin powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder. Stir well to coat the chicken evenly.
4. Now, add the Mango Pickle from National Foods. Mix well to ensure the chicken is evenly coated with the pickle.
5. Add salt to taste. If you find the pickle too salty, you can add a little water.
6. Let the chicken cook on medium heat for about 10-15 minutes, or until it's fully cooked. Stir occasionally to prevent the chicken from sticking to the pan.
7. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves before serving.

Enjoy your Mango Pickle Chicken Curry! Remember, you can adjust the ingredients to suit your taste.

Description: National Crushed Pickles offers a perfectly balanced taste of crushed mixed vegetables in every bite, making it the perfect meal companion. Its unique crushed format makes it easy to eat and allows you to pair it up with anything and everything. Whether used as a condiment, stuffing, topping, ingredient for cooking or even as a spread over paratha, National Crushed Pickle will add just the right excitement to your meal! It is packed in a convenient jar with foil seal which helps keep the freshness intact.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for a Crushed Pickle and Cream Cheese Spread that you can make using Crushed Pickle from National Foods.

Ingredients:
1. 1 cup (225g) of National Foods Crushed Pickle
2. 8 oz (226g) of cream cheese, softened
3. 1/4 cup (59ml) of mayonnaise
4. 1 tablespoon (14g) of white sugar
5. 1/2 teaspoon of mustard powder
6. Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, mix together the softened cream cheese, mayonnaise, sugar, mustard powder, salt, and pepper until smooth.
2. Stir in the crushed pickle until well combined.
3. Taste and adjust seasonings if necessary.
4. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving to allow the flavors to meld together.

This spread is great for sandwiches, wraps, or as a dip with veggies or crackers. Enjoy!
Ingredients: 1. National Foods Crushed Pickle (1 cup or 225g)

Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for a Hyderabadi Chana Dal that pairs well with the pickle:

Ingredients:
1. 1 cup Chana Dal (split Bengal gram)
2. 4 cups water
3. 2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter)
4. 1 teaspoon cumin seeds
5. 1 large onion, finely chopped
6. 2 green chilies, slit
7. 1 teaspoon turmeric powder
8. Salt to taste
9. 1 cup Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle from National Foods

Instructions:
1. Rinse the chana dal under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the dal in enough water to cover it for at least 4 hours, or over night.
2. Drain the soaked dal and place it in a pressure cooker. Add 4 cups of water, turmeric powder, and salt. Close the pressure cooker and cook on medium heat until 3-4 whistles are released. Turn off the heat and let the pressure release naturally.
3. Heat ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them sizzle for a few seconds. Add the chopped onions and green chilies, and sauté until the onions are golden brown.
4. Once the dal is cooked and cooled, mash it slightly with the back of a spoon. Stir in the sautéed onions, green chilies, and ghee. Mix well.
5. Finally, add the Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle from National Foods and mix it gently into the dal. Serve the Hyderabadi Chana Dal hot with rice or roti.

Enjoy your meal! Remember, the amount of pickle you add can be adjusted based on your taste preference.
Ingredients: 9. Hyderabadi Mixed Pickle from National Foods

Description: National Classic Mayo is made from premium quality natural ingredients and high grade procedures which makes it thick, creamy and flavorsome. Made with real eggs, National Classic Mayo offers the authentic taste of Mayonnaise along with essential nutrients such as Omega 3 & 6 and Vitamin A. Our Mayo can be used as a spread for burgers, sandwiches and wraps and also as a dip for fries. National products are carefully packaged under strict hygienic conditions, ensuring quality at every step of the process.
Recipe:
Here's a simple recipe for a Classic Chicken Salad using National Foods' Classic Mayo.

Ingredients:
1. 2 boneless, skinless chicken breasts (cooked and chopped)
2. 1/2 cup of National Foods Classic Mayo
3. 1/2 cup of diced celery
4. 1/2 cup of diced red bell pepper
5. 1/2 cup of diced grapes (seedless)
6. 1/2 cup of chopped walnuts
7. Salt and pepper to taste
8. Lettuce leaves, sliced cucumber, and cherry tomatoes for serving

Instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the cooked and chopped chicken, National Foods Classic Mayo, celery, red bell pepper, grapes, and walnuts.
